clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used for treatment in psychosis schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorders manic disorders and bipolar disorders as monotherapy or in combination

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Asenapine is a serotonin dopamine noradrenaline and histamine antagonist in which asenapine possess more potent activity with serotonin receptors than dopamine Sedation in patients is associated with asenapine s antagonist activity at histamine receptors Its lower incidence of extrapyramidal effects are associated with the upregulation of D1 receptors This upregulation occurs due to asenapine s dose dependent effects on glutamate transmission in the brain It does not have any significant activity with muscarinic cholinergic receptors therefore symptoms associated with anticholinergic drug activity like dry mouth or constipation are not expected to be observed Asenapine has a higher affinity for all aforementioned receptors compared to first generation and second generation antipsychotics except for 5 HT1A and 5 HT1B receptors
